required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of UCB Combined With UC-MSCs in the Treatment of Bone Marrow Failure Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Collaborative Clinical Study of Umbilical Cord Blood Combined With Umbilical Cord Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells in the Treatment of Bone Marrow Failure Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: Shandong Qilu Stem Cells Engineering Co., Ltd.

collaborator.agency: Qilu Children's Hospital of Shandong University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Shandong First Medical University
The affiliated hospital of Jining medical college
The Affiliated Hospital of Binzhou Medical College
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Shandong University of traditional Chinese Medicine
Gansu Provincial Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Harbin Medical University
Air Force Hospital of Western War Zone
The First People' s Hospital of Yunnan Province
The First People's Hospital of Jingzhou

clinical_study.source: Shandong Qilu Stem Cells Engineering Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The multicenter collaborative clinical study conducted a systematic clinical observation in the treatment of bone marrow failure diseases via UCB&UC-MSCs , in order to observe its clinical efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate efficacy of UCB in combination with UC-MSCs in the treatment of bone marrow failure disorders

secondary_outcome.description: To assess Progression-free Survival (PFS) of the combination
To assess overall survival (OS) of the combination

intervention.intervention_name: Umbilical cord blood & Umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells
intervention.description: Intravenous infusion of umbilical cord blood and umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells (5-8×10^7) at 1 week interval.
